items.title: Michael Hearn accused of sharing 'fascist' material
items.summary: Writing for Byline Times, Olly Haynes has revealed troubling content shared by Richmond Park candidate Michael Hearn. The article reveals that Hearn previously faced calls…
items.content_html:
Writing for Byline Times, Olly Haynes has revealed troubling content shared by Richmond Park candidate Michael Hearn.

The article reveals that Hearn previously faced calls to resign from the Conservative Party after sharing far-right material. In 2018, as reported by Evolve Politics, Hearn had listed Hajo Hermann as an ‘inspirational person’ on his Facebook account.

Hajo Hermann was a Nazi lawyer who went on to defend Holocaust deniers (including David Irving) and neo-Nazis in court late into his life.

Hearn is also reported to have shared content from neo-fascist group Generation Identity, and Britain First.

Calling for people to vote for Reform on Facebook recently, Hearn is reported to have written “as an Englishman we have seen our entire country changed without our consent without thought without consideration to our tribes within the kingdom our heritage and culture”, and “rapists murderers terrorists and tomorrow’s groomers of our children can just walk in”.

Hearn appears to have at least two Twitter/X identities (@StormHearn and @HearnStorm), both of which combine parts of his full name, and are linked by references to the East India Company logo, references to Stevenage, and being a paramedic. Both of these accounts have posted racist content. For example, in a reply to a post referring to London Mayor Sadiq Khan walking his dog, @HearnStorm posted

Has he strapped small explosive vests to them yet like his friends in Hamas do.

Sources:

  • Byline Times | Another Reform Candidate Who is Former Conservative Councillor Accused Of Sharing ‘Fascist’ Content [https://archive.is/V9CKI]
  • Evolve Politics | EXCLUSIVE: Tory Councillor with neo-Nazi links calls UK immigrants “dregs of every nation” [https://archive.ph/1pOxS]
  • The Comet | Calls for Conservative county councillor to be expelled for Facebook comments ahead of Stevenage election [https://archive.ph/jzSaA]

items.title: Leslie Lilley said he would ‘slaughter migrants’
items.summary: Leslie Lilley, not content with being outed for his links to Gary Raikes, has also made worrying statements on Facebook about refugees. The Southend East…
items.content_html:
Leslie Lilley, not content with being outed for his links to Gary Raikes, has also made worrying statements on Facebook about refugees. The Southend East & Rochford candidate made the comments on his official Facebook campaign account.

In June 2020, Lilley responded to news of a small boat arriving in Dover by posting: “I hope I’m near one of these scumbags one day I won’t run away I’ll slaughter them then have their family taken out.” He also suggested Border Force vessels should have razor wire to tear small boats carrying migrants across the Channel.

Lilley has also argued that the pandemic was a plan to “depopulate the world” and was “mass murder by government”.

Source:

  • Reform candidate Leslie Lilley said he would ‘slaughter migrants’ (archive)

items.title: Steve Beatty adds Conspiracy Theorist to his resumé
items.summary: It shouldn’t surprise anyone that Didcot and Wantage candidate Steve Beatty, previously linked to Gary Raikes on Facebook, turns out to be a conspiracy theorist.
items.content_html:
It shouldn’t surprise anyone that Didcot and Wantage candidate Steve Beatty, previously linked to Gary Raikes on Facebook, turns out to be a conspiracy theorist. The Express reported to have commented “Correct” on a cartoon of the Bible’s three wise men, with one saying “there was no pandemic”, another saying “climate change is a hoax”, and a third saying “Men can’t get pregnant”:

In another post, Beatty joined in the WEF conspiracy favoured by some Reform supporters, suggesting that Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer “represent” their “paymasters”, the World Economic Forum.

He further suggested that Keir Starmer is being “installed” as Prime Minister to “take the country to war and implement Agenda 2030”.

‘Agenda 2030’, a meeting of the UN to set Sustainable Development Goals, is linked by some conspiracy theorists to numerous nefarious plans, such as forcing people to eat insects, and confining them in ‘15 minute cities’.

Despite standing for election in the General Election, he also confusingly described the “whole ‘election’” as a “farce”.

Source:

  • Express | Reform UK candidate said climate change is a myth and the pandemic was a hoax on Facebook

items.title: Edward Oakenfull claimed immigration linked to IQ decline
items.summary: The Derby Telegraph reports that Derbyshire Dales candidate Edward Oakenfull claimed the UK’s IQ was being “diluted” and put in “severe decline” due to immigration.
items.content_html:
The Derby Telegraph reports that Derbyshire Dales candidate Edward Oakenfull claimed the UK’s IQ was being “diluted” and put in “severe decline” due to immigration. The comments, which Oakenfull would later claim were taken out of context, were madeon Twitter/X in June 2023, after losing an election for a borough council seat in May:

The gene pool decline is another interesting area. By importing loads of sub Saharan Africans plus Muslims that inter breed the IQ is in severe decline.

Other comments include allegations that “nothing good will come out of importing yet more Muslims”. He added, “You think the pro Palestine/ Hamas marches over the past few weeks are disturbing, you ain’t seen nothing yet!”

Oakenfull also said in November: “There are loads of different minority groups within the police, Black Police Officers Association, Muslim, even Turkish, what the hell happened to the police? They succumbed to woke and are now just not fit for purpose.” In December he said: “The newly appointed Chair of the BBC is a Muslim, another reason to cancel the license (sic) as you just know more woke drivel will be churned out!”

Approached for comment, Oakenfull said:

With regards to the comments made by myself on twitter, the majority are taken out of context for example the comments regarding importing sub Saharan Africans and diluting the gene pool, this was part of a conversation regarding a book called the Bell Curve which relates to IQ levels in different countries around the world. I was discussing the content of the book.

With regards to the tweet about our police force. I welcome diversity within the police force but I don’t agree with all the groups within the police force. It should be one police force not segregating different races within it. And in my opinion the police have become too soft and there is more emphasis on hate crime rather than real crime.

With regards to my tweet made on 10/11/23. Migration is off the scale and some Muslims who come to this country do not wish to integrate and we are seeing evidence of this with Sectarian Politics. With regards to my tweet made on 13/12/23. If the newly appointed Chair of the BBC is the best person for the job then brilliant.

However, we are increasingly seeing a tick box culture within our society of promoting minorities into roles rather than the best person for the job. With regards to my tweet made on 10/2/24. Large scale immigration has resulted in community tensions and lack of integration and an increase in anti semitism.

Source:
https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/news/local-news/reform-candidates-resurfaced-tweet-says-9351333

items.title: Angela Carter-Begbie calls King Charles 'weak'
items.summary: Showing that it has a knack for discovering questionable Reform candidates, The Times reports on Angela Carter-Begbie, who has made some ‘interesting’ comments on Twitter/X.
items.content_html:
Showing that it has a knack for discovering questionable Reform candidates, The Times reports on Angela Carter-Begbie, who has made some ‘interesting’ comments on Twitter/X.

In a reply to a deleted post, she described King Charles and Parliament as “weak” and implied he was under the control of global elites. The Queen’s Park and Maida Vale candidate also questioned the King’s loyalty to Britain, at least as far as you call tell from her post:

Just listen about th #proms I will b honest I’m not afan of King Charles. But 2 do th flags @ th #proms how disrespectful of the #BBC 2allow this 2 happen 2 OUR King,in away it is King Charles fault 4 supporting the WEF Think it’s about time King Charles show where he truly lye🇬🇧

In another post from May last year, she referred to King Charles as a ‘WEF muppet. A king should not be a muppet but he is’.

Carter-Begbie frequently posts about the World Economic Forum, apparently believing that the organisation is part of a globalist plot to control, among other things, the EU and both the Labour and Conservative parties. This has been a running theme among many Reform supporters, culminating in Nigel Farage claiming that a Reform government would cancel Britain’s membership of the WEF, despite not being a member…

items.title: Grant StClair-Armstrong steps down over BNP links
items.summary: The Times reports that Grant StClair-Armstrong has stepped down as Reform candidate for North West Essex. In comments unearthed from a 2010 blog, StClair-Armstrong encouraged…
items.content_html:
The Times reports that Grant StClair-Armstrong has stepped down as Reform candidate for North West Essex.

In comments unearthed from a 2010 blog, StClair-Armstrong encouraged voters to vote for the British National Party. He wrote “I could weep now, every time I pick up a British newspaper and read the latest about the state of the UK. No doubt, Enoch Powell would be doing the same if he was alive. My solution … vote BNP!”

The comments were found on an archived version of the website, which has since been changed.

When approached by The Times about the comments, StClair-Armstrong said: “I don’t have this stuff on my website any more. … I removed all that stuff and made the website respectable. … I cleaned up my act a long long time ago. I’m sure if you look around you’ll find some really nice posts, how I feel about animals, animal welfare, how I feel about the planet. It’s not all bad.”

Regarding the Enoch Powel and BNP comments, he said “I’ve got no excuses for that. I think they’re a disgusting party. I don’t like the English Defence League. I don’t like them.” He added that he saw no alternative but to stand down as a Reform candidate.

Sources:
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/article/reform-uk-candidate-resign-bnp-support-q33rphtzt [https://archive.ph/rb07v]

items.title: Gary Raikes' Facebook Friends
items.summary: The Times reports that at least 41 people standing for Reform are connected to Gary Raikes on Facebook. Raikes, a former organiser for the British…
items.content_html:
The Times reports that at least 41 people standing for Reform are connected to Gary Raikes on Facebook.

Raikes, a former organiser for the British National Party, founded the New British Union in the image of Oswald Mosley’s British Union of Fascists, with activists who call themselves “blackshirts”. The New British Union has called for a “fascist revolution” and sees parliamentary democracy as an “obstruction” to be replaced with a dictatorship.

Of the 41 Reform candidates linked to Raikes as Facebook Friends, The Times named the following:

Name Constituency
Steve Beatty Didcot and Wantage
Leslie Lilley Southend East and Rochford
Grant Randall Rayleigh and Wickford

Leslie Lilley, candidate for Southend East & Rochford is also reported as posting messages suggesting that “the Illuminati” control the world and that the Covid-19 vaccine rollout was a “crime against humanity”.

Source:
https://www.thetimes.com/article/10c14799-7f79-4cc1-b845-c4c89b5efd58?shareToken=75aa3040b33773175e187890aa299242 [https://archive.ph/vMwyM]

items.title: Ian Gribbin's remarks on Hitler
items.summary: Bexhill and Battle Constituency Ian Gribbin, candidate in Bexhill and Battle, has apologised for posts he made on the Unherd website, including the claim that…
items.content_html:
Bexhill and Battle Constituency

Ian Gribbin, candidate in Bexhill and Battle, has apologised for posts he made on the Unherd website, including the claim that Britain would be “in a far better state today” if it had “taken Hitler up on his offer of neutrality” instead of fighting the Nazis in World War Two.

Gribbin also wrote that women were the “sponging gender” and should be “deprived of health care”.

Men pay 80% of tax – women spend 80% of tax revenue. On aggregate as a group you only take from society.

Just to cap things off, Gribbin also said Winston Churchill was “abysmal” and praised Russian President Vladimir Putin.

The Reform Party’s initial response to criticisms of the remarks was to defend them, including telling the Jewish Chronicle, “We’re not going to sack him, he’s done nothing wrong.”

After initially declining to comment, Gribbin did later apologise:

I apologise for these old comments and withdraw them unreservedly and the upset that they have caused.”

Commenting on his candidate’s remarks, Nigel Farage claimed vetting issues caused by the unexpected election timing.

Sources:
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cjmmrwexv4ko

Robert Lomas Barnsley North Claimed asylum seekers had it “in their DNA to lie” and that “black people of Britain” were “grifting the race card”
Marc Burca Kensington and Bayswater Defended Ghislaine Maxwell, saying her sentence was “very harsh and vindictive” as “she seemingly facilitated a few 16-17-year-old prostitutes”
Hugo Miller Horsham Called black Americans “negroes” and said they should feel “gratitude” for being allowed to integrate into American society
Andrea Whitehead Leeds West and Pudsey Liked a Facebook post labelling Sadiq Khan an “undercover Jihadist”
Craig Birtwistle Worsley and Eccles Liked a post calling for a complete ban on Islam, which added: “Let them leave if they don’t like it.”
Ken Ferguson Wirral West Liked an anti-vax message on social media, an Islamophobic tweet joking that Muslim men married 12-year-olds and a post denying human-induced climate change

Stewart Sutherland Blaenau Gwent and Rhymney Promoted a tweet by leader of Britain First that claimed Sunak and Khan’s political success was evidence of the “Great Replacement”, a racist conspiracy theory
Lucian Fernando Hastings and Rye Fined and disqualified from driving in 2021 for being drunk in charge of a car, and six months later was caught driving whilst disqualified and also had a charge upheld for failing to provide a blood sample. “I made a mistake and I learnt from it.”

items.title: Lee Anderson wants refugees sent to the Outer Hebrides
items.summary: Ashfield Constituency Ex-Labour, ex-Conservative Reform candidate for Ashfield has a solution for dealing with asylum seekers that doesn’t involve sending them to Rwanda. According to…
items.content_html:
Ashfield Constituency

Ex-Labour, ex-Conservative Reform candidate for Ashfield has a solution for dealing with asylum seekers that doesn’t involve sending them to Rwanda. According to Lee Anderson, speaking to Jo Coburn on the BBC’s Politics Live,

… there is another solution to the illegal migrants, and this is going to probably get me into some sort of hot water with you lot in the media.
I said this to a previous home secretary, I won’t say which one, but if some of these migrants do land on the beaches, let’s take them to a remote Scottish island somewhere, the Outer Hebrides where nobody lives, give them the building material and let them set their own camps up.
I’m sure they’ll be safe and free from persecution in war-torn France.”

Sources:
